Where to begin...

[u]The Good[/u]

-Sweet sweet adrenaline - Both killers and survivors will love getting high on their own glands.  Careful audio engineering consistently builds climaxes that make the immersion here next-level.
-People play - Generally, the community is less toxic and annoying than other online games, with a few exceptions.  The teamwork required as a solo-queue survivor doesn't appear in every game, but it's quite common to work together with strangers, getting saved, healed, etc.
-The licenses:  Oh boy it sure is fun to play as Nancy from Stranger Things or as Freddy from Elm Street.  Unfortunately, see below in section labeled "The Ugly".
-Plenty of replayability as you improve with experience.  Lots of variability in the characters that can make a big difference, and you can spend years trying to unlock everything.

[u]The Bad[/u]
-Pay-to-win is the dark side of the Force.  The base characters are weak, with the strongest killers and survivors hidden behind DLC.  The middle of the road characters can be unlocked with roughly 20 in game experience levels (about 50 hours) or by purchasing them for 5 bucks per. If you want to know how I feel about P2W, go read my Warthunder review. 

-For matchmaking to not be a major time sink, the game would need one solo killer for every 4 survivors.  It's clearly very popular for Twitch cliques to min-max a group of survivors to go make dopes out of the few killers that queue up.  I would love to play survivor more, but solo-queue takes 20 minutes, where killers get a game instantly.  Guess I don't get to play Nancy after all.

[u]The Hideous[/u] 

-Leasing IP rights from someone like Netflix and then selling DLC based on it means your community gets screwed over when those rights expire.  Stranger Things DLC was REMOVED this weekend, including my favorite map in the game.  I'm still able to play the characters, but any new players won't be able to access them.  That breaks the whole game, and frankly pisses me off for having me buy something that was trimmed down after the sale.  

-The Demogorgon:  The "paid DLC only" killer has an add-on they can bring to the game that REVEALS ALL SURVIVORS for 5 seconds, and he can use it repeatedly. In the same update, the free base character "Deathslinger" was nerfed while the Demogorgon became exclusive to anyone who bought the DLC before November 2021.  So again, when queueing, I have the option of getting teabagged at the exit gates by the twitch squad as the Deathslinger or gobbling them all up round 1 with little effort as the Demo. 
 
-Fucking brutal.  Don't get me wrong, that can be a good thing, but something about the first-person brutalizing of an innocent unarmed player (remember, you both [i]experience[/i] it and you're both real people) makes the game sit unplayed in many steam libraries.  It's simply too much, and it's another reason you don't have that many people playing killer, which further borkes the queue.  I mean the clown eats peoples thumbs [i]in first person[/i].  

Go do something else. I wish I had.

What can I say? If you play this game you both love it and hate it.
There's nothing like raging over getting hit right when you're about to escape through the exit. Then the killer letting you crawl your way towards the gate before picking you up.
But, there's also nothing like that feeling of getting the perfect escape, dodging the killer tactfully, and making it out alive.

DbD has been a recent game obsession of mine. I am buying all the characters slowly and learning to play more tactfully and with skill, instead of running around and having no idea whats going on.
If you're looking for a game that you could always learn how to improve in, and a game that can continually get harder--this is the game for you. Some killers suck, some survivors suck... But then, you get a killer you've never faced before and BOOM. You're terrible. 
The game is a learning experience while still being fun and enjoyable when you aren't raging.

It offers the rift, which is similar to a season pass. You unlock fun rewards and wearable charms for your survivors and killers as you progress. It offers multiple survivors/killers, all with custom perks and unique outfits to customize to your desire. It also has daily "rituals" (quests) where you can earn the games currency of bloodpoints and further your knowledge and depth of the game.

DbD overall is not a bad game. It is ever growing and releasing new content monthly. If you want to become a part of a stable but growing community of gamers, join!

ADDRESSING THE RECENT COMMENTS ABOUT HACKING AND THE GAME "NOT BEING AS GOOD AS IT USED TO."
I have been playing for 2 weeks everyday and have NEVER been in one game with a hacker. None of my friends have either.
The game may not be the same as it was "long long ago," but that's because games change. For the people with thousands of hours, of course it will be different. But for newer players this is all we know. From my own personal new experience I LOVE this game and have only been involved with one bad killer, but they weren't even hacking. They were just trolling.

Game is crap

Play killer and you will get bullied

Play survivor and you will get tunneled and facecamped

One of the most toxic communities who love to write essays on post game chat on how bad each other is at the game

For every one new feature they add ten more bugs

After the first few hours, the horror element when found out by the killer turns into "ahh shit, here we go again"

Some perks are literally useless to the point you think its intentional 

There is a tremendous amount of bad survivors who think they are Noob3 but get downed in 3 seconds and instantly disconnect ruining the experience for everyone else

Why is the word facecamp censored at the in game chat?

BHVR must have fired the single person they had to check player reports years ago because it is 100 times more likely to have Santa Claus personally deliver a ferrari to your front door than a toxic player getting a penalty

Don't get me going about the insane amount of grinding required to get perks

Servers often act weird and you get hit by very questionable swings or even straight up invalidating your hits 

Also has frame drops depending on map, killer etc

10/10 I still play every day

Dead by Daylight is a thrilling horror game, where you play hide and seek from serial killers as you try to escape with friends. This game is super fun to play by yourself, with randoms, or with friends. There is always something new in this game. Whether it's different abilities, tools, or survivors/monsters. I highly recommend that everyone play DBD at least once.

纯萌新玩家。粗略的玩了一会屠夫。
个人建议：萌新别玩屠夫，玩的话要么就抱着钩子上的人别松手，要么就盯着那几个穿的花里胡哨的人死追。封门是神技，专门兜那几个在出口疯狂蹲起的人类的逼脸。还有就是别碰护士，这个东西不是一般人能驾驭的。
游戏的后期我不知道屠夫的情况会不会好一点，游戏的前期屠夫的游戏体验几乎为零。除了DBD可怜你给你施舍四个人机的第一把，之后你能匹配到的人类基本上都是顶配。
还有就是车队。
人家就没想着怎么逃出去怎么赚分

人家来就是为了折磨屠夫的。

建议制作组加一个祭品，烧了之后屠夫头上出现血条。
有心脏病史的朋友还是不要玩了。鄙人就曾经有些心脏问题，打算明天去医院复查。
实在受不了那气咱们就找个墙角去面壁，大伙都没游戏体验。反正人类匹配要好几分钟，咱们几乎是秒匹配。
人类只玩了几局，过段时间再补充。
